# Pull Request

## Description

<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes -->

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Test improvements
- [ ] Code refactoring

## Checklist

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have run `black` and `isort` on Python code
- [ ] I have run `styler` on R code (if applicable)

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have checked my code with `pytest` (Python)
- [ ] I have checked my code with `testthat` (R, if applicable)
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

### Documentation
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the README if needed
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG (if applicable)

### CI/CD
- [ ] All GitHub Actions checks pass
- [ ] Code coverage has not decreased (or decrease is justified)
- [ ] I have tested this on multiple Python versions (if applicable)
- [ ] I have tested this on multiple R versions (if applicable)
